title: Drawing, Recto, Design for a door handle with alternative suggestions, ca. 1660–80
title_raw: Recto, Design for a door handle with alternative suggestions
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Recto: left and right halves of different designs are joined. Left motif is composed of a dragon and flying putto, with foliate decoration; right motif, a half-figure and putto with foliate decoration enframe a rondel showing Hercules seated. Verso: left half shows a dragon's foreparts resting on a scrollwork bracket; right half, a flying putto and an eagle. Below, joined, two putti support the keyhole.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Recto, Design for a door handle with alternative suggestions, ca. 1660–80. pencil, pen and bistre ink. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4541.
